verses.verse: and indeed you do so toward all the brethren who are in all Macedonia. But we urge you, brethren, (1 Thess. 3:12) that you increase more and more;
that you also aspire to lead a quiet life, (2 Thess. 3:11; 1 Pet. 4:15) to mind your own business, and (Acts 20:35) to work with your own hands, as we commanded you,
(Rom. 13:13; Col. 4:5; (1 Pet. 2:12)) that you may walk properly toward those who are outside, and that you may lack nothing.
The Comfort of Christ’s Coming But I do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning those who have fallen asleep, lest you sorrow (Lev. 19:28) as others ((Eph. 2:12)) who have no hope.
For (1 Cor. 15:13) if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so God will bring with Him (1 Cor. 15:20, 23) those who sleep in Jesus.

For this we say to you (1 Kin. 13:17; 20:35; 2 Cor. 12:1; Gal. 1:12) by the word of the Lord, that (1 Cor. 15:51, 52; 1 Thess. 5:10) we who are alive and remain until the coming of the Lord will by no means precede those who are asleep.

For ((Matt. 24:30, 31)) the Lord Himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of an archangel, and with ((1 Cor. 15:52)) the trumpet of God. ((1 Cor. 15:23); 2 Thess. 2:1; Rev. 14:13; 20:6) And the dead in Christ will rise first.

((1 Cor. 15:51-53); 1 Thess. 5:10) Then we who are alive and remain shall be caught up together with them (Dan. 7:13; Acts 1:9; Rev. 11:12) in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And thus (John 14:3; 17:24) we shall always be with the Lord.
(1 Thess. 5:11) Therefore comfort one another with these words.
The Day of the Lord But concerning (Matt. 24:3) the times and the seasons, brethren, you have no need that I should write to you.
For you yourselves know perfectly that (Luke 21:34; 1 Thess. 5:4; (2 Pet. 3:10); Rev. 3:3; 16:15) the day of the Lord so comes as a thief in the night.
For when they say, “Peace and safety!” then (Is. 13:6-9) sudden destruction comes upon them, (Hos. 13:13) as labor pains upon a pregnant woman. And they shall not escape.
((Acts 26:18); Rom. 13:12; Eph. 5:8; 1 John 2:8) But you, brethren, are not in darkness, so that this Day should overtake you as a thief.
You are all (Eph. 5:8) sons of light and sons of the day. We are not of the night nor of darkness.
(Matt. 25:5) Therefore let us not sleep, as others do, but (Matt. 25:13; Mark 13:35; (1 Pet. 5:8)) let us watch and be sober.
For ((Luke 21:34)) those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk (Acts 2:15; 2 Pet. 2:13) are drunk at night.
But let us who are of the day be sober, (Is. 59:17; Eph. 6:14) putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and as a helmet the hope of salvation.
For (Rom. 9:22) God did not appoint us to wrath, ((2 Thess. 2:13)) but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,
(2 Cor. 5:15) who died for us, that whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with Him.
Therefore comfort each other and edify one another, just as you also are doing.
Various Exhortations And we urge you, brethren, (1 Cor. 16:18; 1 Tim. 5:17; Heb. 13:7, 17) to recognize those who labor among you, and are over you in the Lord and admonish you,
and to esteem them very highly in love for their work’s sake. (Mark 9:50) Be at peace among yourselves.
Now we exhort you, brethren, (2 Thess. 3:6, 7, 11) warn those who are unruly, (Heb. 12:12) comfort the fainthearted, (Rom. 14:1; 15:1; 1 Cor. 8:7) uphold the weak, (Gal. 5:22) be patient with all.
(Lev. 19:18) See that no one renders evil for evil to anyone, but always (Rom. 12:9; Gal. 6:10; 1 Thess. 5:21) pursue what is good both for yourselves and for all.
((2 Cor. 6:10)) Rejoice always,
(Eph. 6:18) pray without ceasing,
in everything give thanks; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.
(Eph. 4:30) Do not quench the Spirit.
